questions.question_text:
You are implementing a reporting solution that has the following requirements:
Reports for external customers must support 500 concurrent requests. The data for these reports is approximately 7 GB and is stored in Azure Synapse Analytics.
Reports for the security team use data that must have local security rules applied at the database level to restrict access. The data being reviewed is 2 GB.
Which storage mode provides the best response time for each group of users?

choices.B: DirectQuery for the external customers and import for the security team.
choices.C: DirectQuery for the external customers and DirectQuery for the security team.
choices.A: Import for the external customers and DirectQuery for the security team.
choices.D: Import for the external customers and import for the security team.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Agree that A is correct. Thanks for your links.

Selected Answer: A

Selected Answer: A
I took the exam a few days ago (14/8/2023) and I passed the exam with a score of 915.
My answer was:
- Import for the external customers and DirectQuery for the security team.

Selected Answer: A
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/power-bi/connect-data/desktop-directquery-about#the-underlying-source-defines-security-rules

A is the correct answer. The external users problem is solved by Import mode, as explained here https://community.powerbi.com/t5/Service/One-report-for-multiple-users-simultaneously/m-p/1749731#M124530. And the security team requirements involves security at the data source level which can only be achieved through DirectQuery as explained under DirectQuery use cases on this link https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/power-bi/connect-data/desktop-directquery-about.
